pros: best team I have ever worked with. interesting and challenging work. real impact.
cons: runs very lean, it's not for everyone.

pros:
Allowed to work remote
Growth opportunity
cons:
None at the moment
Team members should meet often

pros: Good work environment and the people are nice
cons: The pay is not commensurate with the level of experience required to work here.

pros: great people and great objectives
cons: the management team is not aligned

review_title: Great culture and people, high-growth environment
pros: Really talented group of high performing people. People really stay a long time and grow a lot within the organization.
cons: Fast paced and a lot is expected of you

pros: Great work life balance for employees
cons: A lot of changes in program strategy

pros: THE PEOPLE! People are truly nice to each other, flexible, and no politics. Everyone is also very growth and mission driven.
cons: The flexibility is not for everyone. There is a lot of ambiguity.

pros: Great Culture, Collaborative and growth oriented. Values team members.
cons: None at the moment. It is a great environment

review_title: Fulfilling work, team can be improved
job_title: US Operations Manager in Denver, CO
pros: Work was fulfilling and the mission really resonates. They give you the opportunity to travel to countries they run programs in at least once if your position is in the US (and not on the ground running programs).
cons: The US team lacked diversity, they were pretty much all white females from a nonprofit background so that creates a very narrow perspective of the collective team. Became a bit cringy.

pros:
-Lot of responsibility given to ppl with few years of experience
-Committed to Youth-First values
-Committed to working with government and sustainability
cons:
-Staff are very overworked and paid below market value (candidates who are qualified and experienced turn down offers when they see pay scale)
-Staff are regularly burnt out and overwhelmed
-Hiring is based on commitement to organisation values and willingness to overwork
-Expectation to be as motivated as co-founders about the mission is unrealistic
-Not very recognisable org/brand for future jobs

pros: Dedicated, fun, and supportive team, with lots of new opportunities to grow and learn.
cons: Good for individuals who prefer a fast-paced work environment with high levels of responsibility

pros:
- hires talented, motivated and fun people
- strong vision
- innovative work place
cons:
- low pay 
- leadership can sometimes come across as narrow-minded
- E! boasts a non-hierarchical leadership structure; however, I found this to not be the case

pros: Great place for learning professionally
cons: Great place for part timing

review_title: Educate is a growing organisation with small manageable teams
pros: Great teams, professional growth through weekly learnings
cons: No room for growth unless if someone retires or leaves

review_title: Amazing opportunities for growth if you are motivated to put in the work
pros: Very committed, growth-oriented, and caring team environment. The mission is inspiring and felt day to day.
cons: Very fast pace of change which can be a pro or a con depending on how you like to work.

job_title: Program Officer I in Karura, Nairobi
pros: Great teamwork. They appreciate every member of the team
cons: Job uncertainities. You can wake up and there is no job

job_title: Head of Business Development in Kampala
pros: Innovative, fast-growing company with unparalleled opportunities for growth and professional development. Strong emphasis on mentorship. Entrepreneurial environment where you have autonomy to develop and implement new work. Hard work rewarded with flexibility. Strong mission and alignment of strategic decisions to impact.
cons: Prospective employees should enjoy working in fast-paced environment with high degree of personal responsibility! (not a con, just something to note)

pros: Great overall  vision for youth with a passionate leadership team at the forefront and dedicated hard working staff implementing the program country wide. Impact is visible.
cons: Too much focus and passion on company impact in the sector and culture of the organisation. However this passion level does not extend to the staff leaving many demotivated.

pros: Educate! has an amazing mission and a great group of people to work with. Everyone's ideas are listened to and as a fast growing organization there are so many opportunities to tackle new tasks and challenges.
cons: I have not found one

review_title: Incredible team, great career development, powerful mission
pros: Exciting high-growth work environment, great co-workers, lots of training and development opportunities, important mission and impact
cons: Not a good fit for someone who doesn't enjoy a fast-paced environment.
